traceability.evidence: - CLI supports --format=json flag (bin/dry-aged-deps.js parseOptions and printHelp include --format description). - Manual run: `node bin/dry-aged-deps.js --format=json` outputs valid JSON with timestamp, packages array, and summary including thresholds. - Unit tests covering JSON output: test/cli.format-json.test.js confirms valid JSON, correct exit codes (0 or 1), no stderr noise, filtering behavior by age and security. - Unit tests for printOutdated JSON formatter: test/printOutdated.json.test.js verifies full package entries (name, current, wanted, latest, recommended, age, vulnerabilities, filtered, filterReason, type) and summary thresholds. - Error handling tests: test/cli.format-json.error.test.js confirms JSON error output format with error object (message, code, details) and exit code 2, no stderr output. - parseFormatFlag validates allowed formats and rejects invalid ones; invalid--format value tests pass in test/cli.invalid-options.test.js. - Default behavior remains table format when no --format flag provided, as shown in other CLI tests. - Help documentation includes --format option.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for story 008.0-DEV-JSON-OUTPUT are fully implemented and verified by automated tests and manual inspection. JSON output is valid, complete, silent on stdout for errors, and integrates with exit codes as specified.
